meanings.definition: An act or instance of revolting against civil authority or an established government.
meanings.sent1: The insurrection led to chaos in the city.
meanings.sent2: The rebels planned an insurrection against the king.
meanings.sent3: The insurrection at the school cafeteria over the new lunch menu was quite dramatic.
meanings.sent4: The insurrection of colors in the painting created a striking effect.
meanings.sent5: The insurrection of the waves against the shore was a powerful sight.

meanings.definition: A rebellion or uprising against authority or government.
meanings.sent1: The failed insurrection resulted in many arrests.
meanings.sent2: The history books are filled with tales of insurrection.
meanings.sent3: The insurrection of the squirrels in the park for more acorns was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The insurrection of ideas in the meeting room sparked a lively debate.
meanings.sent5: The insurrection of flavors in the dish made it unforgettable.
